Healthy Breakfast: Lentils Dosa : South India Servings: 14 Dosa Duration : 3 dosa's can cook in 15 mins South Indian healthy Breakfast recipe is adai dosa / Lentils Dosa which is full of protein, spices and flavor of ginger. It is easy and quick to make Dosa's when Batter is ready. What's special in this breakfast it contains four different variety of lentils which has high in protein and also gives energy. This dosa gives a good aroma of lentils & ginger. It can be prepared in two ways: 1. Time consuming :
  • I chose this method because the lentils & Dal has enough time for fermentation
  • So your Dosa will be smooth in hand and crispy outside of dosa
  • The process is same like Green gram Dosa, Soaking overnight & making batter in the morning
  • Detailed process explained in procedure sectionÂ 
  • Batter is ready & make Dosa's ðŸ˜€
2. Can be prepared in 2 hrs :
  • Soak all lentils & rice in a deep bowl for 2 hrs
  • Add dry Red chillies, ginger, cumin seeds & salt along with lentils & dal in mixer grinder
  • Blend semi coarse / smooth paste
  • Batter is ready & make Dosa's ðŸ˜€
Nutrition facts of Lentils: Red gram/ pigeon Peas:Â  Vitamins: A & B6 Minerals: Iron, Calcium, magnesium & potassium Bengal gram/ chickpea: Vitamins: B6 Minerals: Iron, Calcium, magnesium & potassium Urad Dal/ Black gram: Vitamins: B6 Minerals: Iron, Calcium, magnesium & potassium Moong Dal/ Mung bean: Vitamins: C Minerals: Iron, Calcium, magnesium & potassium Every lentil used in this recipe is high in proteinÂ  Today, I prepared a tasty & healthy protein Dosa which is adai Dosa/ lentils Dosa. Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients: 1/2 cup = Â 120 gms Rice - 1/2 cup Red Gram - 1/2 cup Moong Dal - 1/2 cup Bengal Gram - 1/2 cup Urad Dal - 1/2 cup Dry Red chillies - 6 Ginger - 1/2 tb sp Cumin seeds - 1 tsp Salt - 1/2 tb sp Oil - 3 tb sp Procedure:
  • Wash lentils & rice twice
  • Drain water & add fresh water
  • Soak 8 hrs and also soak dry Red chillies in a separate bowl
  • Drain water
  • Add soaked lentils & rice in mixer grinder along with dry Red chillies, chopped ginger, cumin & salt
  • Blend semi coarse / smooth paste
  • Next heat tava on medium to high
  • Sprinkle water on tava to check tava is heated/ not
  • Add one ladle Dosa Batter on tava
  • Spread batter in circular motion as shown in picture
  • Apply oil
  • Close with lid & cook 1 min
  • Remove lid and flip Dosa when color changes to golden brown
  • Cook other side
  • Serve it hot with peanut chutney/ Spicy Ginger Chutney/ Allam pachadiÂ ðŸ˜‹
  • Enjoy your day & Happy Cooking ðŸ˜Š
